main event: Sightings of multiple unidentified objects by military personnel in Korea during the early 1950s.
interesting points: The first report involves 2 white lights observed visually and by air observers in Pusan, Korea, on 13 February 1954., The second report describes visual and radar sightings of a moving ball of fire with a streamer of flame at an altitude of approximately 10,500 feet., A pilot and ground radar observer of the 1st Marine Aircraft Wing reported strange blips moving at high speed during an encounter with unidentified objects., One object was tracked at over 20,000 feet traveling at speeds exceeding 1,000 knots, beyond the capabilities of known aircraft., Several military officers and pilots were involved in these sightings, but evaluations lacked sufficient data.
sighted object: 2 white lights and unidentified flying objects (UFOs)
